stories.text: Can anyone help me understand why there are seemingly dozens of different libraries for DI/IOC for JVM languages? From what I can tell they all do the exact same thing just with slightly different syntaxes/patterns. Is there any canonical guide out there for choosing one?
stories.title: Ask HN: Why so many DI libraries for the JVM?
We chose Telegram for team-app, and then moved away from it (2020)
Quarto – a scientific and technical publishing system built on Pandoc
There oughta be GTA5 for the Game Boy
Show HN: I noticed the negative sentiment on Web3, so I made a useful Web3 app
What it’s like to make $100k+ walking dogs
I reviewed your SaaS startups and side-projects and they SURPRISED Me

stories.text:
I use to track trends on Stackoverflow jobs[0] and just recently I found jobs with Julia as a requirement. I also track package creation rate on major languages and Julia is now on the same level as Elixir, R or Swift.

Disclaimer: I'm not involved in Julia. I don't even use the language, it's just some "trivia" and trend recognition.

[0] https://stackoverflow.com/jobs?tl=julia
stories.title: Tell HN: Jobs posted on Stackoverflow are finally asking for Julia
